intro: Simarouba amara var. puberula, commonly known as the roughleaf simarouba, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its rough, pubescent bark and elliptical leaves with a prominent midrib. Its flowers are small and yellowish, and it produces woody capsules containing aromatic seeds.
